oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hyperbolic three-manifolds that embed geodesically
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Martelli, Bruno
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Geometric Topology
Mathematics - Differential Geometry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We prove that every complete finite-volume hyperbolic 3-manifold $M$ that is tessellated into right-angled regular polyhedra (dodecahedra or ideal octahedra) embeds geodesically in a complete finite-volume connected orientable hyperbolic 4-manifold $W$, which is also tessellated into right-angled regular polytopes (120-cells and ideal 24-cells). If $M$ is connected, then Vol($W$) < $2^{49}$Vol($M$). This applies for instance to the Whitehead and the Borromean links complements. As a consequence, the Borromean link complement bounds geometrically a hyperbolic 4-manifold.
Comment: 11 pages, 6 figures. Minor corrections from the previous versions
